content:
It is not possible for me to know your region, but the best way to determine the native plant species in your region is to consult with local botanic gardens or resource centers. they will be able to provide you with information on the specific plants that grow well in your area, including endangered plants that need protection. you may also want to consider joining a local gardening club, which can provide you with tips, resources, and information on the native plant species in your area.

in general, native plant species are best for enhancing biodiversity and supporting local ecosystems. some popular native plants include:

1. purple coneflower (echinacea purpurea)
2. black-eyed susan (rudbeckia hirta)
3. butterfly weed (asclepias tuberosa)
4. bee balm (monarda didyma)
5. eastern red cedar (juniperus virginiana)

by planting native plant species in your garden, you can create suitable habitat for endangered plant species and improve biodiversity in your local ecosystem.
